abstract.text: Creates a view that represents the body of a subscription store control.

inlineContent.text: The properties of a subscription store control that includes the list of auto-renewable subscriptions to merchandise.
A view which provides UI controls to subscribe to a subscription service.
Implement this method to define a custom subscription store control style which conforms to the
. Use the
input — a value of

— to access the collection of subscription options to merchandise, and other properties of the controls. Return a view that provides controls for someone to choose an option from the configuration and subscribe. The following code example defines a style that adds price comparison captions to buttons:

code: if let priceComparison = priceComparison(for: option, allOptions: configuration.allOptions) {
private func localizedPrice(for option: Configuration.Option) -> LocalizedStringKey {
// Use 'displayPrice' and 'subscriptionPeriod' on 'option' to localize the price.
private func priceComparison(for option: Configuration.Option, allOptions: [Product]) -> LocalizedStringKey? {
guard let subscriptionPeriod = option.subscriptionPeriod, subscriptionPeriod != .monthly else {
// Create a localized string to represent the savings of subscribing to 'option' compared to paying per
// month with 'monthlyOption'. For example, "Save $20.00 per year compared to the monthly option".

inlineContent.text: The
structure in the example code provides a button to subscribe to each option in the
property of the
, along with an optional informative caption for options with durations longer than one month. By calling the

method when a button is triggered, the subscription store view automatically manages a purchase task with the appropriate purchase options. The buttons automatically use the same button style as standard subscription store control styles, but you can customize this using
Since the control style creates a
for each option, the subscription store view automatically lays out the stacks appropriately. You could instead provide an explicit layout container around
to customize the spacing and alignment of the buttons.
To handle cases where the monthly plans aren’t visible, the control style uses the
property to compute price comparsions instead of
The control style reads properties of
directly on the
using dynamic member lookup, such as
Whenever any of the properties of
change, the system calls your
method again to display an updated view.
The above example provides a button per plan, but not all control styles need to work this way. For example, you could combine multiple controls together with buttons, such as
or
, and use state to implement more complicated interactions.

content.text: Modifying subviews of standard control styles

inlineContent.text: The
in the example code above uses the
type to add buttons, but you can also use the
view to modify the standard subscribe button. When within the scope of a type conforming to
, you can simply spell this view as
For example, the following update to the
example code uses
instead of

code: if let priceComparison = priceComparison(for: option, allOptions: configuration.allOptions) {
private func priceComparison(for option: Configuration.Option, allOptions: [Product]) -> LocalizedStringKey? {
// Create a localized string to represent the savings of subscribing to 'option' compared to paying per
// month with 'monthlyOption'. For example, "Save $20.00 per year compared to the monthly option".

inlineContent.text: The updated custom style no longer needs to implement a custom
method, instead the
automatically creates the localized label. The custom style uses the
view modifier to only show the price in the button’s label.
You can also create custom control styles which modify the standard subscription picker control by using the
type. When within the scope of a type conforming to
, you can simply spell this view as
. For example, you can create a style to modify the standard subscription picker to use a custom label for the picker options:
The
in the example code provides a picker control to select a plan from the
by providing the
value to the
view.
The first closure provided to the subscription picker receives a
value, and returns a view to use as the label for each picker option. The subscription picker calls this closure once for each option in the configuration’s
property. The style uses the
property of
via dynamic member lookup to indicate which plan the picker option corresponds to. If the subscription store is configured to merchandise an offer, the custom style shows a label by checking
. The style uses the
property to adjust the visibility of a checkmark indicating the selected plan. The
property is available instead of
when declaring subscription picker option labels.
The second closure provided to the subscription picker receives a

value, providing a control to confirm the currently selected plan. The custom style only provides custom picker option, and uses the standard subscribe button for the confirmation content. The standard subscribe button displays the price of the selected option.
You can also access the standard subscription picker option label by using

abstract.text: A control that initiates an action.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of identified data.
A control for selecting from a set of mutually exclusive values.
A control that toggles between on and off states.
A view that arranges its subviews in a vertical line.
Sets the style for buttons within this view to a button style with a custom appearance and custom interaction behavior.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
Information about a product that you configure in App Store Connect.
Information about an auto-renewable subscription, such as its status, period, subscription group, and subscription offer details.
The duration of time between subscription renewals.
The localized display name of the product, if it exists.
A button for subscribing to an in-app subscription with a localized label and optional caption.
A placement for a subscription store control in a store view.
A type that specifies the appearance and interaction of controls in the subscription store view instances within the view hierarchy.
A view that represents the body of a subscription store control.
The properties of a subscription store control that includes the list of auto-renewable subscriptions to merchandise.
The placement of subscription controls in a subscription store.
A button for subscribing to an in-app subscription.
A composite control for selecting a subscription option and confirming the subscription.
A subscription option within a subscription picker control.
Creates a view that represents the body of a subscription store control.
The properties of a subscription store control that includes the list of auto-renewable subscriptions to merchandise.
Properties of an auto-renewable subscription option to merchandise.
Initiates a purchase when a customer activates a control to subscribe to the option.
The properties of a picker option to use for selecting a subscription.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the picker option is in a selected state.
All subscription options in the subscription group.
An array of subscription options for the subscription store view to merchandise.
A composite control with a picker for selecting a subscription option and a button for confirming the subscription.
A subscription option within a subscription picker control.
A custom parameter attribute that constructs views from closures.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
